DOC.brief_summary: Fentanyl is expected to suppress tracheal tube-induced cough during emergence from general anaesthesia through binding to its receptors in the brainstem. However, it has not been proven if fentanyl has a complication-free, dose-dependent effect on cough suppression during emergence from sevoflurane anaesthesia. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the relationship between fentanyl doses and cough suppression during emergence from sevoflurane anaesthesia.
DOC.brief_title: Dose-dependent Effect of Fentanyl on Cough Attenuation During Emergence From General Anaesthesia
DOC.criteria: the patients undergoing general anaesthesia for elective thyroidectomy due to thyroid neoplasm. ASA III. 2059 years old. female only. signs of difficult intubation. risks for perioperative pulmonary aspiration. history of chronic respiratory disease. recent upper respiratory track infection. previous and recent smoking history
